radiographic_examinations.findings: Small locules of free air in the anterior abdominal cavity and retroperitoneum. Diverticulosis with marked wall edema and surrounding inflammatory fat stranding in the sigmoid colon. A loculated area of hypodensity suggesting intramural abscess (1.9 x 2.7 cm) and multiple adjacent locules of extraluminal gas. Foci of free intraperitoneal air throughout the abdomen and below the diaphragm. A 20 x 14-mm fluid collection adjacent to the inflammation in the lower left pelvis that could represent a developing abscess.
